intro: Diacidia rufa, commonly known as the red-stemmed diacidia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Diacidia rufa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along streambanks.
